feed.title: SAP Community - SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central
feed.subtitle: SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Part time email notification alert not triggered
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Good day to you.

We have this requirement for HR started the transfer process, working hours to be changed to limited/unlimited in this case limited, HR to approve. Employee and manager as well gets the notification.

Job info:
Event reason-transfer

1. Approver HR
CC: Manager and employee

1st Reminder to HR and employee: 28days before expiration
Part Time Contract for [[SUBJECT_USER]] is ending in 28 days. Please talk to your supervisor or go into the system to extend it or change it to a different model.

2nd Reminder to HR: 14 days before expiration

All the necessary configuration has been setup in the system (workflow, alert message, business rule and assigned into the job info).

New Part time contract ending 28days is setup with condition working hours equals to limited and event reason transfer.

We have done the testing from our end, however, still did not receive the part time email notification alert.

Kindly advise.

Thank you.

entry.title: Transfer Direct Reports upon Termination
entry.content:
Currently when HR is filling in termination for a Mgr with direct reports they see fields regarding 'Transfer Direct Reports'. They have multiple choices there (move subordinates to upper mgr; to other mgr or individual transfer), but since information from Org chart is currently overwriting Mgr information overnight - only 'upper mgr' should be selected.
Please allow to modify only one selection for HR (move subordinates to upper mgr).

entry.title: Leave Encashment from Annual Leave Quota every year should not go beyond a Capping of 150 days
entry.content:
Namaste Everyone,

In this blog we shall understand a challenge we faced in Time Off - Leave Encashments and how did we arrive at a peculiar solution.

Problem Statement:

The number of days that can be accumulated for a particular Leave Encashment from Annual Leave Quota every year and should not go beyond a Capping of 150 days for the member's service period. This shall be paid to an employee at time of retirement only.

Problem Transformation in SAP/SF Consulting Terms:

An Employee is eligible to take days from Annual Leaves Quota as Leave Encashment every year. When we try to take Leave Encashment until Year 2029, it should allow us to save as Capping is 150.

However, when an employee tries to take Leave Encashment for Year 2030, it should error out and not let an employee save the record. Please refer to below screenshot: 

NOTE: We can take various variations of this encashment: 15 each year would take 10 years to reach capping of 150 days.

Challenges in Standard Approach:

  1. There is no Standard Fit to fetch the data stored in Time Account for Payouts to meet this requirement.
  2. Addition of Payouts from different years.
  3. Rule definition to cater to Payouts from different years.

Solution Proposed:

Leave Encashments leave a trail of Pay Component attached for Leave Encashments within the Compensation – Non-Recurring Portlet. We trickled down this Portlet to:

1.Fetch the number of days of Leave Encashment in a particular year.

2.Pass them on to a field “Placeholder” in a Custom MDF (Encashment) for that year via an Integration Job.

3.From “Placeholder”, it is cumulated via business rule to fill Cumulative Capping in a field “Cumulated Capping”. 

┌──────────────────────────────┐

│ Employee applies Leave

│ Encashment │

└───────────────┬───────────────┘

                │

                ▼

┌──────────────────────────────┐

│ Pay Component created in

│ Compensation – Non-Recurring

│ Portlet │

└───────────────┬───────────────┘

                │

                ▼

┌──────────────────────────────┐

│ Fetch number of Encashment │

│ Days for the year │

└───────────────┬───────────────┘

                │

                ▼

┌──────────────────────────────┐

│ Integration Job transfers to

│ MDF (Field- Placeholder) │

└───────────────┬───────────────┘

                │

                ▼

┌──────────────────────────────┐

│ Business Rule cumulates into │

│ "Cumulated Capping" field │

└───────────────┬───────────────┘

                │

                ▼

┌──────────────────────────────┐

│ Validate against yearly

│ capping limit │

└───────────────┬───────────────┘

                │

                ▼

┌──────────────────────────────┐

│ If within limit → Allow

│ If exceeded → Restriction

└───────────────┬───────────────┘

 

Technical Build: 

1. Let us check the Leave Encashment page and try to place Payouts.

 

 

 

2. This should create a Payout linked Pay Component in Non-Recurring Portlet. Let us check that out:

As we can see the Leave Encashment days – 30 are captured here in “Number” field of Pay Component – DEMO_PC_LEAVEENCASH

3. We create an Integration Centre job that shall carry the required data from Non-Recurring Pay Components Portlet to fields in Custom MDF (Annual Encashment)

4. After running IC job, we can see field “Placeholder” carries 30.

Pay Component field carries: DEMO_PC_LEAVEENCASH (as we want values associated only to this Pay Component to be sent to this MDF) 

 

5. But what about field- Cumulated Capping?

We shall create another business rule to carry the “Placeholder” values to “Cumulated Capping.” It will function as a Summation counter adding previous and present values.

6. We shall continue to fill in 30 days till 2029. In Year, 2030- this should give us an error on taking any Leave Encashment days as then it would be greater than capping i.e., 150 days.

 

7. Let us check that in our instance:

We have taken Leave Encashments from YEAR 2025 till 2029. Cumulative Capping thus becomes 150.So, it should error out on YEAR 2030.

ERROR RULE:

Some checks for the YEARs of encashments taken: 

We will run IC job in the backend for every year of Leave Encashment filled. 

As such, MDF also has field- Cumulated Capping = 150.

8. We shall create Payout Request now:

When we try to Submit this record, an error comes. 

In the manner above, we were able to provide solution to this challenging problem by use of Integration Centre and a lot of Consulting expertise.

Hope you find it helpful!

 

Thanks,

Rahul VijayKiran Mattoo.

entry.title: Story report for concurrent employment
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Currently, we are using concurrent management in SuccessFactors for a project.

I would like to know whether it is possible to create story report which shows the only employees who have concurrent employment.

Additionally, the requirement is to output the total number of concurrent employment(if one employee have 3 concurrent, then 3 lines or display "3") and show who has concurrent employment.

Is such kind of feature available in story report?

entry.title: How to trigger workflows for new hires hiring by import?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We have a requirement, we generally hire the employees in mass by using the employee data templates. Is it possible to trigger the workflows on new hires by importing the data through templates?

Regards

Shaik

entry.title: Integration Center fields not pulling all data
entry.content: I have a field mapped (nickname) in Integration Center, it is not pulling all data for the field (getting blanks where I show data is populated on employee profile). I get returned data for some profiles just not all that I am expecting. The only filter on my integration is UserNav>status = t or f. I have removed this filter to check and still have the same results.

entry.title: Change position title text color - hover
entry.content:
Hello,

Please how to change the position title text color - hover in theme manager?

entry.title: SAP SuccessFactors and Entra Integration - Issue
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I'm experiencing two different writeback errors when provisioning from Azure AD to SuccessFactors. Most users provision successfully, but a few are failing with these specific errors. Any guidance would be appreciated!

Issue 1: Regulatory Right to be Removed

An entry cannot not be provisioned in this target: SuccessFactors. The entry is 1xx92. The reason the entry cannot be provisioned is internal to that application. An example of why an entry cannot be provisioned is a user with a given public identifier, such as an email address, having previously exercised a regulatory right to be removed from the application.

Issue 2: Missing Required Properties

Error code: SuccessFactorsWritebackRequiredPropertiesMissing
Error message: Please add required properties in payload. Required property status is missing. You can check which properties are required for an entity in Admin Center > OData API Data Dictionary or the entity metadata. with the index 0

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Position Matrix Relationship Sync with Job Relationship
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are experiencing a synchronization issue between the Position Matrix Relationship and Job Relationship. 
I am aware about a job that synchronizes the Job Relationship based on the data from the Position Matrix Relationship. This process involves a delta update from the Position Matrix (Position record must be effective from current date or future date) to the Job Relationship and does not take into account historical data of Position for updating the Job Relationship in retroactive scenarios. 
Is there an alternative method to synchronize the Position Matrix Relationship with the Job Relationship for historical records as well, to ensure data consistency across all records? 

https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-employee-central/implementing-position-management/setting-up-automated-position-matrix-relationship-to-job-relationship-synchronization-job

Best Regards

entry.title: Odata response with null entity with HRIS emp central permission ON
entry.content:
{
  "d": {
    "__metadata": {
      "uri": "https://{companyurl}/odata/v2/PerPerson('UseriD')",
      "type": "SFOData.PerPerson"
    },
    "personIdExternal": "{perPerson}", //This value is present
    "lastModifiedDateTime": "/Date(1305980631000+0000)/",
    "createdDateTime": "/Date(1305980630000+0000)/",
    "createdOn": "/Date(1305980630000)/",
    "countryOfBirth": null,
    "placeOfBirth": null,
    "lastModifiedBy": "v4admin",
    "dateOfBirth": null,
    "customString2": null,
    "perPersonUuid": "*************",
    "lastModifiedOn": "/Date(1305980631000)/",
    "customString1": null,
    "createdBy": "v4admin",
    "regionOfBirth": null,
    "customLong2": null,
    "personId": "*****",
    "customLong1": null,
    "customString1Nav": {
      "__deferred": {
        "uri": "https://{CompanyURL}/odata/v2/PerPerson('UseriD')/customString1Nav"
      }
    },
    "personalInfoNav": {
      "results": []
    },

 

Hi,

I have a permission role set up in SAP SuccessFactors with following rules:

  • Employee central HRIS Odata permission is given to the user.
  • The granted user is given to a group containing a single user
  • The target population is selected as All employees
  • The effective dated entities [Personal Information] and employee data [Biographical information] is selected

Although I am getting a 200-response code when calling the endpoint https://{companyURL}/odata/v2/PerPerson({userID}),

The personalInfoNav is null.

entry.title: Time off Finland - accrual rules and best practices package
entry.content:
Dear community, 

I'm coming to ask if there are customers actually being able to work with Time off in Finland, and having the accrual rules working correctly in the cases of parental leaves.. I've been checking the best practices solution deployed in 1H 2024 but this solution does not seem to fulfill the legal requirements. 1H 2024 Release Highlights of SAP Best Practices f... - SAP Community

@NeeleshKamath 

I've been working with a Finnish customer which claims the following legal requirement: Per child, the employee accumulates holidays for a maximum of 160 days of parental leave. This count is made Monday to Saturday. The moment the employee reaches that limit, he stops accumulating holidays in the months he is still absent due to the same child birth. The employee can take the parental leave until the child becomes 2 years old. 

This needs to work together with the Finnish 14 days rule : an employee accumulates holidays for a certain month as long as he has worked at least 14 days in a month. That can be controlled with rule functions "Get Number Of Working Days Or Hours For Period()" from accruable start date to accruable end date. (OK until there)

So what the Best Practices rule (SFCC_ACC_FIN_Holiday_Credit_Accruals)  does is the following: count parental leaves in deduction quantity up to 160 days (monday to saturdays), and from that moment, penalize the employee. In a month, we will get the working days MINUS the days above 160 to see if it is above/below 14 days for the accrual. This solution is never considering which child the absence is about (what if you have multiple children?) and never considering the 2 years period mentioned above (it is checking the 160 limit in the year). 

As a result: this would never work well in reality!

For example imagine an employee has parental leave (reaching 160 days) on the 28th of June 2025, and he is on parental leave until the 12th of july (Saturday).

According to the Best Practices rule, the working days in july are 23. 

The days exceeding 160 days are from the 1st of july until the 12th (in yellow), saturdays included = 11

23 minus 11 = 12 days. 12 days is below 14 days, so the employee should not be eligible to accumulate holidays in that month. 

But in reality the employee should accumulate holidays because: 

Working days = 23

Working Days absent due to parental leave = 9

23 minus 9 = 14 days. Equal or above to the 14 days limit. so he would accrue days for that month. 

The difference is mixing units: working days vs deduction quantity. And deduction quantity days could be even greater than the working days!

So, seriously, has any company been able to work with this successfully?

 

Thank you very much for your time

Laura

entry.title: Implementing OIDC Authentication for SuccessFactors API Integration
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Requirement Overview:
We are working on integrating a front-end application with SuccessFactors. In this scenario, users log in through the front-end application and request their information from SuccessFactors. To enable this, we need to expose the SuccessFactors OData APIs to this application.

SuccessFactors OData APIs support OAuth 2.0 with SAML Assertion. The typical process is:

  1. Request a SAML assertion.

  2. Use the SAML assertion to obtain an access token.

  3. Use the access token to query the APIs.

Currently, for the SAML assertion step, we are using the /oauth/idp API to generate SAML assertions for our exposed APIs. This setup is working, but as per the official documentation (link), this method is considered insecure and has been deprecated, which may affect the APIs we expose to external systems going forward.

Proposed Solution:
We are planning to implement OIDC-based authentication for the APIs exposed from SuccessFactors to external systems.

  • We followed the official guide to configure the Identity Authentication and Identity Provisioning services (link) and attempted testing using Postman.

  • During testing (Step 10), we were asked to select the “SAP SuccessFactors” application, but the option only works when “Administration Console” is selected.

Further testing, as per this guide, yielded the following:

  • We successfully called the /oauth2/token API and obtained an ID token from the Identity Authentication service.

  • We made a second API call to obtain an API access token using the ID token from the previous step.

  • However, using this access token, we are unable to access APIs in the SAP SuccessFactors HCM suite. Getting the 401 authentication error while querying SuccessFactors OData APIs:

    Error Response:
    **********************
    {
    "error": {
    "code": "AuthenticationFailed",
    "message": "Authentication service failed to return token.",
    "details": "Failed to authenticated OIDC token"
    }
    }
    ************************

Key Requirements:

  • The official documentation suggests using grant_type=password, which we want to avoid for security reasons.

  • We intend to use grant_type=authorization_code so that users can log in via SSO through the front-end application, and their session can be used to access the APIs.

  • We would appreciate guidance on setting this up, specifically:

    1. How to configure the authentication flow for users logging in through the front-end application.

    2. How to configure it when an application (rather than users) needs to consume SuccessFactors APIs.

We request your help in setting this up correctly and securely. Leads to documentation/blog posts or any sort of help will be highly appreciated. 

@CarlosRoggan @DeepakGDeshpande 

Regards,
Pavan

entry.title: OIDC Authentication for SuccessFactors API Integration
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Requirement Overview:
We are working on integrating a front-end application with SuccessFactors. In this scenario, users log in through the front-end application and request their information from SuccessFactors. To enable this, we need to expose the SuccessFactors OData APIs to this application.

SuccessFactors OData APIs support OAuth 2.0 with SAML Assertion. The typical process is:

  1. Request a SAML assertion.

  2. Use the SAML assertion to obtain an access token.

  3. Use the access token to query the APIs.

Currently, for the SAML assertion step, we are using the /oauth/idp API to generate SAML assertions for our exposed APIs. This setup is working, but as per the official documentation (link), this method is considered insecure and has been deprecated, which may affect the APIs we expose to external systems going forward.

Proposed Solution:
We are planning to implement OIDC-based authentication for the APIs exposed from SuccessFactors to external systems.

  • We followed the official guide to configure the Identity Authentication and Identity Provisioning services (link) and attempted testing using Postman.

  • During testing (Step 10), we were asked to select the “SAP SuccessFactors” application, but the option only works when “Administration Console” is selected.

Further testing, as per this guide, yielded the following:

  • We successfully called the /oauth2/token API and obtained an ID token from the Identity Authentication service.

  • We made a second API call to obtain an API access token using the ID token from the previous step.

  • However, using this access token, we are unable to access APIs in the SAP SuccessFactors HCM suite. Getting the 401 authentication error while querying SuccessFactors OData APIs:

    Error Response:
    **********************
    {
    "error": {
    "code": "AuthenticationFailed",
    "message": "Authentication service failed to return token.",
    "details": "Failed to authenticated OIDC token"
    }
    }
    ************************

Key Requirements:

  • The official documentation suggests using grant_type=password, which we want to avoid for security reasons.

  • We intend to use grant_type=authorization_code so that users can log in via SSO through the front-end application, and their session can be used to access the APIs.

    1. How to configure the authentication flow for users logging in through the front-end application.

We request your help in setting this up correctly and securely. Leads to documentation/blog posts or any sort of help will be highly appreciated. 

@CarlosRoggan @DeepakGDeshpande @

Regards,
Pavan

entry.title: OData API Reference for Phone Numbers in SuccessFactors
entry.content:
Hello Experts

I am looking for an OData API Reference currently available in SAP SuccessFactors. I am planning to create an integration for which I need to know the structure of the employee phone record in SuccessFactors. For this I am in need of a reference as to what is currently available in OData API for phone numbers.

Please suggest where can I get the documentation / reference for OData API for phone numbers.

Thanks in advance

Arul

entry.title: Permission Role History report
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

We are having an external Audit and the auditors asking us to show them what permission roles certain users had back in the time. We do know that there is a change report for this, but it is not showing us the actual History of what roles the person had at given times.

Does anyone know how to obtain this information from the tool? Anyone had the same audit question? 🙂

Thank you!

Adorján

entry.title: Rehire with Old Employment Failing Replication
entry.content:
Hello!

My team is trying to understand a replication issue we've encountered, caused by Rehire with Old Employment records.

The scenario we’ve encountered is:

  • When we perform a Rehire on Old Employment, as soon as the verification step is complete, a job information Rehire entry appears on the employee profile in EC.
  • This happens *before* Manage Pending Hires is completed.
  • This entry replicates and throws an error

See example employee Zach Booth. This Rehire record appeared on his old employment record (the name one where his termination record is) before onboarding was completed.

Zach Booth in Onboarding:

Based on my research, this is expected behavior (source: https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3195854).

It is difficult to manage these replication errors, and it feels unintuitive to have these records created before Manage Pending Hires is completed.

Can you confirm that my understanding is correct? Can you help me understand why this happens and how other clients manage it?

entry.title: 2H 2025 SuccessFactors Release Schedule
entry.content:
2H 2025 SuccessFactors Release Dates

Key Dates: 2H 2025

MilestoneDate
Preview Release WindowOctober 13, 2025
Production Release WindowNovember 14-16, 2025
  • Preview is when the upcoming changes/features are available in non-productive instances so you can test.
  • Production is when changes go live in customer production environments.

SAP classifies new release items into four enablement categories:

  • Customer Configured → Needs manual setup by the customer.

  • Contact Product Support → Activation/troubleshooting by SAP Support.

  • Contact Enablement Partner → Setup help from your partner.

  • Contact CEE / Account Manager → Enabled via your SAP Contact Customer Engagement Executive or Account Manager.

  • Automatically On → Delivered by default, no setup needed.

You need to align with your client or business stakeholders to determine which features should be adopted immediately and which should be put on hold for later.

With the 1H 2025 release, SAP SuccessFactors provides a clear framework to help customers understand how new features are enabled, what actions are required, and their lifecycle status.

 

DimensionCategoriesPurpose
Enablement
  • Customer Configured
  • Contact Product Support
  • Contact Enablement Partner
  • Contact CEE/Account Manager
  • Automatically On
Defines how a feature becomes available to you – whether it requires manual configuration, assistance, or is enabled by default.

Actions

  • Info Only
  • Not Applicable
  • Recommended
  • Required
Explains what you need to do – from awareness only, to mandatory adoption.
Lifecycle
  • General Availability
  • Deprecated
  • Deleted
Shows the current and future state of a feature – whether it’s active, being phased out, or fully removed.

Regards,

Mahnoor Naseem

SAP SuccessFactors Consultant

If you found this blog a useful please consider giving it a Kudos
